alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CLARK, NORTHEASTERN GREENE AND SOUTHWESTERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 201 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Cedarville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, London, Yellow Springs, Cedarville, Jamestown, South Charleston, Wilberforce, Harmony, Lisbon, Brighton, South Vienna, South Solon, Clifton, Buck Creek State Park, Springfield Municipal Airport, Hustead, John Bryan State Park, Selma, Pitchin and Interstate 70 at State Route 56. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 52 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
